section.title: Placing Comments
section.para: We use git blame to track what category of comment has been applied to an author. Since skeleton files and chapters often contain elements committed by a scrum master, course architect, or another author, the placement of review comments is important.
In the past, comments were placed after the closing XML tag for the element in which an error was found. For example:
section.screen: <para> The next step when modifying a style is to set your new style option so that your processor knows what it is. Use the <command>xsltproc</command> command or use stylesheets. </para> <!-- TechEdit: It's not clear how to do this. Suggested: "You can set a parameter dynamically as part of your <command>xsltproc</command> command, or you can make the change in an additional stylesheet." -->
section.para: In this example, the <para> element was entered into the document by the course architect but the text was written by a course developer. The comment therefore appears to be referring to the work of the course architect rather than the course designer. That is incorrect.
From now on, comments will now be placed on the line after the error to which it refers:
section.screen: <para> The next step when modifying a style is to set your new style option so that your processor knows what it is. Use the <command>xsltproc</command> command or use stylesheets. <!-- TechEdit: [logic] It's not clear how to do this. Suggested: "You can set a parameter dynamically as part of your <command>xsltproc</command> command, or you can make the change in an additional stylesheet." --> </para>
section.para: In this example, the comment is clearly about the content rather than the XML tag.

There may be some exceptions to this rule, including the <title> elements (those are defined by the DCO, so the committer of the title content and the title tag tends to be the same) and the <listitem>, which is embedded deep enough within other tags that they tend to be committed by the same person who wrote the content.

section.title: Responding to Comments
section.para: When authors process comments, they are expected to respond to each one.
We have defined standard responses that demonstrate that a comment has been seen and processed in some way. They are:

listitem.para: It might seem like this is wrong, but it's actually correct.
I disagree with your assessment, and choose not to fix this.
For some reason, I am unable to fix this problem.
I don't understand what you want from me.
